com.xhive.core.interfaces
Interface XhiveLockingContextIf

All Known Subinterfaces:
XhiveBlobNodeIf, XhiveCCIndexIf, XhiveDatabaseIf, XhiveDocumentIf, XhiveIndexIf, XhiveLibraryChildIf, XhiveLibraryIf, XhiveLinkBaseIf
public interface XhiveLockingContextIf

This interface is implemented by objects that represent a locking context, and enables users to lock such an object explicitly.

A locking context represents a group of objects that are locked together, which means that if you lock one of the objects in the group all the other objects in the group will be locked at the same time.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0

Field Summary
static int READ
          Lock mode: The locking context is locked for read.
static int UPDATE
          Lock mode: The locking context is locked for update.
static int WRITE
          Lock mode: The locking context is locked for write.
 
Method Summary
 XhiveSegmentIf getSegment()
          Find the segment that contains this object.
 void lock(int mode)
          Explicitly locks this object and propagates the lock to objects in the same locking context.
 

Field Detail

READ

static final int READ
Lock mode: The locking context is locked for read. Read locks are allowed together with other read locks and one update lock.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

WRITE

static final int WRITE
Lock mode: The locking context is locked for write. Write locks are exclusive, they are not allowed together with any other locks.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

UPDATE

static final int UPDATE
Lock mode: The locking context is locked for update. Update locks can be shared with read locks, but not with other update locks.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

lock

void lock(int mode)
Explicitly locks this object and propagates the lock to objects in the same locking context.

Parameters:
mode - The type of lock to obtain for this object; either READ, WRITE or UPDATE.
Throws:
XhiveLockNotGrantedException - When the lock could not be obtained
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0

getSegment

XhiveSegmentIf getSegment()
Find the segment that contains this object.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0
